title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid

sources.title: Butch Cassidy And The Sundance Kid (1969) Paul Newman · Robert Redford
sources.description: Around 1900, two bandits are nearly chased to death by unknown pursuers after a train robbery. They escape to Bolivia with a friend, rob banks again, and are finally caught by the militia and their persistent pursuer.   An impressively photographed tragicomic Western with plenty of humor that doesn't capitalize on the deeper potential of the theme of relentless chase and escape, instead remaining on the surface of successful entertainment.

sources.title: Butch Cassidy And The Sundance Kid 1969
sources.description: Butch Cassidy And The Sundance Kid 1969

metadata.Plot: Butch and Sundance are the two leaders of the Hole-in-the-Wall Gang. Butch is all ideas, Sundance is all action and skill. The west is becoming civilized, and when Butch and Sundance rob a train once too often, a special posse begins trailing them no matter where they run. Over rocks, through towns, across rivers, the group is always just behind them. When they finally escape through sheer luck, Butch has another idea, "Let's go to Bolivia". Based on the exploits of the historical characters.
metadata.Actors: Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Katharine Ross
